thread.title: Holly Willoughby looks bleary-eyed as she parties after the Brit Awards - doesn't she have to be up early?
thread.title_full: Holly Willoughby looks bleary-eyed as she parties after the Brit Awards - doesn't she have to be up early?

author: Vicki Newman
title: Holly Willoughby looks bleary-eyed as she parties after the Brit Awards - doesn't she have to be up early?
text:
Holly Willoughby partied hard at the Brits last night (Photo: Goff/Splash) Share Get     
Holly Willoughby didn't let her early alarm clock ruin her night. 
The TV presenter let her hair down at the Brit Awards last night despite having to be up first thing to present This Morning. 
The blonde beauty was spotted leaving the Warner Music after party, where she headed alongside the likes of Ed Sheeran and Game Of Thrones star Maisie Williams after the ceremony at London's O2 Arena. 
This Morning kicks off at 10.30am today, so if Holly is taking on the hosting duties alongside her presenting partner Phillip Schofield, she would have had to be up pretty early this morning. Read More Holly partied it up (Photo: GoffPhotos.com) Has she had a few too many? (Photo: GoffPhotos.com) 
The star, who looked gorgeous in a sequined black mini dress with long sleeves, seems to have had a very good night. 
She was looking a little bleary-eyed as she left the bash. 
Perhaps she was going home to get some shut-eye before work today. 
Earlier in the night, Holly posted a selfie on Instagram of herself with an all-access pass given out to artists. 
She posted the snap alongside the message:"Believe..." Time to catch some sleep before work? (Photo: GoffPhotos.com) Holly didn't let her early alarm clock ruin her night (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
Holly also took to the stage at one point to present the Best British Single award to Little Mix alongside best pal Fearne Cotton. 
But how does she handle all of these late nights and early mornings? 
Well, she's quite the pro at it. 
Holly even turned up to present This Morning - with Phillip - wearing the same clothes and having not been home after the National Television Awards last year. 
They actually made it home to change this year, but admitted they were struggling with hangovers. Read More Holly presented an award with best pal Fearne Cotton (Photo: PA) They presented the Best British Single award to Little Mix (Photo: Getty Images) 
For the second year in a row, the best friends appeared on screen a bit worse for the wear after partying until nearly 4am. 
"We have made it in, obviously, today," said a sheepish Phillip. 
"Weâ€™ve made it in not in a brilliant condition to be truly honest but at least we are not wearing the same clothes." 
Holly noted they both had very hoarse voices this morning and there was a lot of "heavy breathing". 
Mirror Celeb has contacted Holly's representatives for comment. Like us on Facebook
